contextId.information: Possible meanings: 1) "beginning from when John baptized Jesus" or 2) "beginning from when John baptized people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: beginning from the baptism of John

contextId.information: This means that God planned out and knew beforehand what would happen to Jesus. AT: "because God planned out and knew beforehand everything that would happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: by God's predetermined plan and foreknowledge

contextId.information: This can be stated positively. AT: "He is the only person who is able to save" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: There is no salvation in any other person

contextId.information: The words "repentance" and "forgiveness" can be translated as verbs. AT: "give the people of Israel an opportunity to repent and have God forgive their sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins

contextId.information: The noun "murder" can be translated as a verb. AT: "still speaking threats, even to murder the disciples" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: still speaking threats even of murder against the disciples

contextId.information: You can translate the word  "repentance" as the verb "repent." AT: "the baptism to repent" or "the baptism that people requested when they wanted to repent for their sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the baptism of repentance

contextId.information: The abstract word "salvation" can be translated with the verb "to save." The phrase "uttermost parts" refers to everywhere. AT: "tell people everywhere in the world that I want to save them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth

contextId.information: The abstract noun "faith" can be translated with the verb "believe." "believed that Jesus could heal him" or "believed that Jesus could make him well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: had faith to be made well

contextId.information: The abstract noun "conversion" means the Gentiles were rejecting their false gods and believing in God. AT: "announced to the community of believers in those places that Gentiles were believing in God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: announced the conversion of the Gentiles

contextId.information: The abstract noun "disagreement" can be stated as the verb "disagree." AT: "They strongly disagreed with each other" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Then there arose a sharp disagreement

contextId.information: You can translate the abstract noun "repentance" as the verb "repent." AT: "the baptism that people requested when they wanted to repent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the baptism of repentance

contextId.information: The word "accusation" can be stated as the verb "accuse." AT: "want to accuse someone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: have an accusation against anyone

contextId.information: This word "rebellion" can be stated as a verb. AT: "caused people to rebel against the Roman government" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: led a rebellion

contextId.information: The word "permission" can be stated as a verb. AT: "the captain permitted Paul to speak" or "the captain allowed Paul to speak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the captain had given him permission

contextId.information: The word "death" can be translated with the verb "kill" or "die."  AT: "and I looked for ways to kill them" (UDB)" or "and I even caused them to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: to the death

contextId.information: The word"sight" can be translated with the verb "see." AT: "see again" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: receive your sight

contextId.information: The word "resurrection" can be stated as "come back to life." The word "dead" can be stated as "those who have died." AT: "those who have died will come back to life, I" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: the resurrection of the dead that I

contextId.information: The word"curse" can be re-stated. It can also be made explicit what would cause them to be cursed. AT: "asked God to curse them if they did not do what they promised" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: called a curse down upon themselves with an oath

contextId.information: The abstract words "death" and "imprisonment" can be stated as verbs. AT: "but there was nothing said against him that should cause Roman authorities to kill him or to send him to prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: but that there was no accusation against him that deserved death or imprisonment

contextId.information: The abstract noun "resurrection" can be stated as "God brings back to life." The nominal adjective "the dead" can be stated as "those who died." AT: "when God brings back to life all who have died, both the righteous and the unrighteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: the coming resurrection of ... unrighteous ones

contextId.information: The abstract noun "defense" can be stated as a verb. AT: "began to defend himself against those who were accusing him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: made his defense

contextId.information: The abstract noun "accusations" can be stated as the verb "accuse." AT: "against all the Jews who are accusing me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: against all the accusations of the Jews

contextId.information: The abstract noun "forgiveness" can be stated as the verb "forgive." AT: "God may forgive their sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: they may receive from God the forgiveness of sins

contextId.information: The abstract noun "repentance" can be stated as the verb "repented." AT: "and start doing good deeds to show they truly have repented" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: doing deeds worthy of repentance

contextId.information: The abstract noun "resurrection" can be stated as "bringing people back to life." AT: "he would be the first person to rise from among the dead ones when God starts bringing people back to life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: he would be the first from the resurrection of the dead ones to rise

contextId.information: The abstract noun "care" can be stated as a verb. AT: "go to his friends so they could care for him" or "go to his friends so they could help him with whatever he needed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: go to his friends to receive their care
